Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pis2 (piscidin; His-rich classic; natural AMPs; fish, animals, UCLL1: Variants: GAD-2)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram-negative bacteria Y. ruckeric NCIMB 2196 and P. immobilisc NCIMB 308 (MIC 2.5-5 uM). A recent study synthesized a peptide variant GAD-2 without the last two C-terminal residues (McDonald M et al., 2015). GAD-2 is much more active at slightly acidic pH. Both Gad-1 and Gad-2 demonstrated concentration-dependent cytotoxicity against LLC cells, HEY ovarian cancer cells, and PC3 prostate cancer cells. Helical in SDS. Structural heterogeneity is proposed. Updated 4/2015.
Literature Information.Author: Ruangsri J, Salger SA, Caipang CM, Kiron V, Fernandes JM.2012
Literature Information.Title: Differential expression and biological activity of two piscidin paralogues and a novel splice variant in Atlantic cod (Gadus morhua L.)
